intro: Houlletia unguiculata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a compact, bushy structure with narrow, linear leaves. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, hairy stems that help it survive in arid conditions. Houlletia unguiculata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
